sentences.en: a grievous shortage of hospital beds
But the court found them guilty grievous bodily harm to kidnapping.
sentences.cn: 但是法庭发现他们犯有人身伤害和绑架罪.

sentences.en: He had been the victim of a grievous injustice.
sentences.cn: 他曾遭受极不公正的待遇。

sentences.en: He survived in spite of suffering grievous injuries.
sentences.cn: 尽管身受重伤，他还是活下来了。

sentences.en: He was charged with maliciously inflicting grievous bodily harm.
sentences.cn: 他被控蓄意严重伤害他人身体.

sentences.en: Her death was a grievous shock.
It was grievous to think that Mr. Slope should have so distanced him.
sentences.cn: 想到斯洛普先生竟然把他这样远远地甩在后面,这是很令人伤心的.

sentences.en: It would be a grievous waste.
sentences.cn: 那将是一种令人可悲的浪费.

sentences.en: Mr. Morris said the victims had suffered from a very grievous mistake.
sentences.cn: 莫里斯先生说受害者们为一个非常严重的失误而受苦。

sentences.en: Not , however, before her regular demand for her allowance became a grievous thing.
sentences.cn: 不过, 这是在她定期要钱用变得难以忍受之后的事.

sentences.en: There was once a grievous famine in the land.
sentences.cn: 该国曾经发生过一次大饥荒.

sentences.en: They felt grievous compassion for her.
sentences.cn: 他们系念着她的不幸的遭遇.

sentences.en: They were both found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm.
sentences.cn: 他们两人都被判造成他人严重人身伤害的罪名成立。

sentences.en: Wasting food when people are starving is a grievous wrong.
sentences.cn: 在别人挨饿时浪费食物是一种严重的罪恶.

sentences.en: When the grievous news came, she was choked with tears.
sentences.cn: 噩耗传来, 她痛哭失声.

words.tran_cn: 令人悲伤地；极其痛苦地

trans.tran_cn: 令人伤心或痛苦的，（指坏事）剧烈的，严重的，悲哀
trans.tran_en: If you describe something such as a loss as grievous, you mean that it is extremely serious or worrying in its effects
